results.title: Catch of the day
results.creator_credit: Sarah Watt, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: The bright, beautiful and spontaneous ocean is something to wallow in. A young girl plays in the ocean and with the fishes. A dashing surfer rides up on his white steed and declares ‘I’ve come - you’ll never have to chop onions again!’ Jane wakes up from her dream (or was it a nightmare?) Working at the fish market, she endures the sexual innuendo and double entendres from male customers and fellow workers alike. When matters come to a head, she cleverly takes the situation into her own hands and offers a unique solution to unsolicited sexual advances… An impressionistic animation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Watt, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Australian Film Commission

results.title: Passionless moments
results.brief_description: A series of suburban vignettes dealing with everyday eccentricities. Filmed in black and white, this is an early work by renowned New Zealand filmmaker Jane Campion. Through a series of alternately ironic and bizarre vignettes, the filmmaker composes a joyful celebration to the beauty of the mundane and the ordinary.

results.title: A Phoenix rising
results.brief_description: A documentary film showing how the community of Mt. Macedon is piecing together its life again after being annihilated by the fires of Ash Wednesday. The film is based on interviews with some of the residents and gives case studies of a couple of families. Written and narrated by John Bonney.

results.title: Because They're Black
results.creator_credit: Education Dept, S A, South Australian Film Corporation, Roy Wooding and Rosemary Burden
results.brief_description: A series of revealing interviews with Aboriginal students show what pressures exist for them in a white racist society. Teachers, parents and teacher’s aides are also interviewed. A good discussion starter for all those involved in the education of Aboriginal students.
